page_content:
![](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/_assets/3137b1a864c689786cac76b3def62dd1/Assets/img/default-banner.jpg)

# Affixing a temporary licence plate and understanding licence plate categories

## TEMPORARY LICENCE PLATE

To legally operate your vehicle, you must affix your temporary paper licence plate to your vehicle while waiting to receive your metal licence plate in the mail. Your metal plate will be delivered by mail within 10 to 20 business days to the primary address in your SAAQ file.

If your vehicle registration is carried out at an SAAQ service outlet or a certified dealer, your temporary paper licence plate will be issued by the service outlet agent or the dealer. If you register your vehicle online via [SAAQclic⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login), you must print your temporary licence plate on standard (8 1⁄2 x 11-inch) white paper as the final step in the online vehicle registration process.

In either case, the temporary paper licence plate must be affixed to the vehicle's rear window in the top left corner. For vehicles that do not have a rear window, such as motorcycles, snowmobiles and all-terrain vehicles, the temporary plate must be affixed in the top left corner of the windshield or to another visible place on the vehicle.

[This video (MP4, 29.8 MB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/plaque-provisoire.mp4) shows how.

## **LICENCE PLATE CATEGORIES**

## Tractors and other farm vehicles - C, R, F or L licence plates This table scrolls horizontally | Type of plate | Description and use | | --- | --- | | ![Example of a licence plate for a tractor, bearing the number C000000](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/c-00000.png) | Tractor used by a farmer in the operation of a farm or for personal use
A tractor must be registered under a C licence plate if it is operated on a public road, even just to cross the road | | ![Example of a licence plate for a farm trailer, bearing the number RA0000A](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/ra0000a.png) | Farm trailer owned by a farmer who uses it in the operation of the farm | | ![Example of a licence plate for a pickup truck or minivan owned by a farmer who uses it in the operation of the farm, bearing the number FAA0000](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/faa0000.png) | Pickup truck or minivan weighing 3,000 kg or less owned by a farmer who uses it in the operation of the farm | | ![Example of a lience plate for a truck or a farm motor vehicle, bearing number L000000](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/l-00000.png) | Farm vehicle weighing more than 3,000 kg owned by a farmer who uses it in the operation of the farm | ## Trucks and combinations of vehicles - L Licence plate This table scrolls horizontally

![Example of a licence plate for a private or public bus or minibus, or a bus or minibus used to transport school children, bearing number A00000](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/a-00000.png)

- for school transportation
- for public transportation, regardless of whether fees are charged
- in the operation of a business
- for personal purposes
- as a police, fire department or emergency vehicle | ## Taxis - T, TR, TS or TB licence plates ### Changes Concerning the Taxi Industry

## Taxis - T, TR, TS or TB licence plates ### Changes Concerning the Taxi Industry The [Act respecting remunerated passenger transportation by automobile⁠ ⁠](http://www.legisquebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/showdoc/cs/T-11.2) came into force on October 10, 2020. T licence plates were taken out of circulation on March 31, 2021. Read the news bulletin [Taxi : informations sur la plaque T et le « pocket » ⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/salle-presse/actualite/taxi-informations-sur-la-plaque-t-et-le-pocket/ "")(taxi: information regarding the T licence plate and pocket number) (in French only). ## Trailers, camping trailers and tent trailers - R licence plate This table scrolls horizontally | Type of plate | Description and use | | --- | --- | | ![Example of a licence plate for a trailer, camping trailer or tent trailer, bearing number RA0000A](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/ra0000a.png) | Vehicle pulled by another registered vehicle
This category includes:
- trailers
- camping trailers
- tent trailers
- semi-trailers
- construction trailers
- farm trailers
- hand-crafted trailers | ## Commercial vehicles and special use vehicles - F licence plate This table scrolls horizontally

page_content:
## Commercial vehicles and special use vehicles - F licence plate This table scrolls horizontally | Type of plate | Description and use | | --- | --- | | ![Example of a licence plate for a commercial vehicle, a farm motor vehicle and certain other vehicles, bearing number FAA0000](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/faa0000.png) | Vehicle used mainly for commercial or professional purposes by a self-employed worker, a business or a natural person.
This category includes:
- commercial vehicles
- farm vehicles
- trucks, pickup trucks and minivans weighing 3,000 kg or less
- vehicles owned by driving schools
- snowblowers
- vehicles engaged in the transportation of school children, excluding buses and minibuses
- snow removal trucks
- tool vehicles
- winter tool vehicles
- equipment transport vehicles
- motor homes owned by a business
- motor homes weighing more than 3,000 kg owned by an individual who uses it for personal purposes
Special use vehicles:
- tow trucks
- ambulances
- hearses | ## Vehicles with restricted-area use - C licence plate This table scrolls horizontally

## Vehicles with restricted-area use - C licence plate This table scrolls horizontally | Type of plate | Description and use | | --- | --- | | ![Example of a licence plate for a restricted-area use vehicle, bearing number C000000](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/c-00000.png) | Vehicle that is not authorized to be operated everywhere on the road network
This category includes:
- [vehicles that operate exclusively in areas that are not connected to the Québec road network](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/registering-vehicle/vehicle-with-restricted-area-use/vehicle-used-in-a-location-that-is-not-connected-to-the-road-network)
- farm tractors
- snowmobiles with a net weight of more than 450 kg
- vintage motorcycles
- [other vehicles with restricted-area use](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/registering-vehicle/vehicle-with-restricted-area-use/other-vehicles-with-restricted-area-use) | ## Vehicles bearing a veteran's licence plate This table scrolls horizontally

## Vehicles bearing a veteran's licence plate This table scrolls horizontally | Type of plate | Description and use | | --- | --- | | ![Example of a plate issued for a vehicle belonging to a veteran, bearing number 123 ABC and the image of poppies, the faces of two soldiers and the word "vétérans"](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/123-abc-veterans.png)
![Example of a plate issued for a motorcycle belonging to a veteran, bearing number 12345 and the image of poppies, the faces of two soldiers and the word "vétérans"](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/12345-veterans.png) | Licence plate strictly reserved for [veterans](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/registering-vehicle/veterans-licence-plate) and given by the [Royal Canadian Legion⁠ ⁠](http://www.qc.legion.ca/english_2/licence_plate_2.html) to those who submit an application. The centre of the plate features the image of a poppy.
This licence plate can be issued for:
- passenger vehicles weighing 3,000 kg or less
- motor homes weighing 3,000 kg or less
- motorcycles | ## Ham radio operator's vehicle - VA2 or VE2 licence plates This table scrolls horizontally

page_content:
## Ham radio operator's vehicle - VA2 or VE2 licence plates This table scrolls horizontally | Type of plate | Description and use | | --- | --- | | ![Example of a licence plate for a ham radio operator's vehicle, bearing number VA2 AB](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/VA2-AB.png)
![Example of a licence plate for a ham radio operator's vehicle, bearing number VA2 ABC](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/VA2-ABC.png)
![Example of a licence plate for a ham radio operator's vehicle, bearing number VE2 AB](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/VE2-AB.png)
![Example of a licence plate for a ham radio operator's vehicle, bearing number VE2 ABC](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/VE2-ABC.png) | Licence plates strictly reserved for vehicles owned by the holder of a valid [ham radio operator's licence⁠ ⁠](http://www.raqi.ca/node/8) (website in French only)
These licence plates can be issued for:
- passenger vehicles weighing 3,000 kg or less
- motor homes weighing 3,000 kg or less | ## Electric, rechargeable hybrid or hydrogen fuel cell vehicles - Green licence plate All electric, rechargeable hybrid or hydrogen fuel cell vehicles must bear a green licence plate. This table scrolls horizontally

This table scrolls horizontally

page_content:
| Type of plate | Description and use | | --- | --- | | ![Example of a dealer plate (X licence plate), bearing number X000000](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/x-000000.png)
![Example of a dealer plate (X licence plate), bearing number XA0000](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/xa-0000.png)
![Example of a dealer plate (X licence plate), bearing number XA00000](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/images/immatriculation/xa-00000.png) | Removable licence plate used by a dealer, a manufacturer, an auto body repair shop or a carrier that is:
- affixed to a trailer or trailer chassis owned by a dealer or manufacturer when these vehicles are pulled without carrying a load
- used to transport road vehicles on a flatbed truck or under their own power-vehicles that are transported in this manner must not carry a load other than what is authorized for road vehicles in the same category
- affixed to a vehicle that is loaned by a dealer, a manufacturer or an auto body repair shop to replace a vehicle that is sold or under repair or to demonstrate its condition of operation or performance-the vehicle that is sold or under repair must not be covered by the requirement to have a permit from the Commission des transports du Québec
A small X licence plate is used by a dealer, a manufacturer or an auto body repair shop to move road vehicles with a net weight of 500 kg or less. |

page_content:
## Personalized licence plates

Visit the [Personalized Licence Plates](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/personalized-licence-plates) webpage to find out about the eligibility conditions, eligible vehicles, and rules regarding character combinations for different types of vehicles.

Last update: July 19, 2023

- ## Costs

- [Cost of registration based on the type of vehicle](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/saaq/rates-fines/vehicle-registration/cost-renewal)

## Safety first, on the road and online

We are committed to protecting your personal information and privacy. That's why, when we collect data, we follow a [Policy on Privacy](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/policies/privacy) that is responsible and transparent. By continuing to browse without modifying your preferences, you accept the use of cookies.

Edit settingsAcceptReject
